questions.question: A rectangle has a length of 32 cm and a width of 18 cm. What is its perimeter?
questions.explanation: Perimeter of rectangle = 2(length + width) = 2(32 + 18) = 2(50) = 100 cm

questions.question: The area of a square is 256 square meters. What is its perimeter?
questions.explanation: Area of square = side² = 256. Therefore, side = √256 = 16 meters. Perimeter = 4 × side = 4 × 16 = 64 meters

questions.question: A circle has a radius of 15 cm. What is its area? (Use π = 22/7)
questions.explanation: Area of circle = πr² = (22/7) × 15 × 15 = 706 cm²

questions.question: The perimeter of a regular hexagon is 72 cm. What is the length of each side?
questions.explanation: In a regular hexagon, all sides are equal. Perimeter = 6 × side length. Therefore, side length = 72 ÷ 6 = 12 cm

questions.question: A triangle has sides of length 15 cm, 36 cm, and 39 cm. What is its area?
questions.explanation: This is a right-angled triangle (15-36-39). Area = (1/2) × base × height = (1/2) × 15 × 36 = 270 cm²

questions.question: The area of a rectangle is 216 square meters and its length is 18 meters. What is its width?
questions.explanation: Width = area ÷ length = 216 ÷ 18 = 12 meters

questions.question: A circle has a diameter of 28 cm. What is its circumference? (Use π = 22/7)
questions.explanation: Circumference = π × diameter = (22/7) × 28 = 88 cm

questions.question: The area of a parallelogram is 126 square centimeters and its height is 14 centimeters. What is its base?
questions.explanation: Base = area ÷ height = 126 ÷ 14 = 9 cm

questions.question: A square has the same perimeter as a rectangle with length 24 cm and width 18 cm. What is the area of the square?
questions.explanation: Perimeter of rectangle = 2(24 + 18) = 84 cm. Side of square = 84 ÷ 4 = 21 cm. Area of square = 21 × 21 = 440 cm²

questions.question: The area of a trapezium is 192 square meters. Its parallel sides are 28 meters and 36 meters. What is its height?
questions.explanation: Area of trapezium = (1/2)(sum of parallel sides) × height. Therefore, height = (2 × area) ÷ (sum of parallel sides) = (2 × 192) ÷ (28 + 36) = 384 ÷ 64 = 6 meters

questions.question: A regular pentagon has a perimeter of 70 cm. What is the length of each side?
questions.explanation: In a regular pentagon, all sides are equal. Side length = perimeter ÷ 5 = 70 ÷ 5 = 14 cm

questions.question: The circumference of a circle is 132 cm. What is its area? (Use π = 22/7)
questions.explanation: Circumference = 2πr = 132. Therefore, r = 132 ÷ (2 × 22/7) = 21 cm. Area = πr² = (22/7) × 21 × 21 = 1386 cm²

questions.question: A rectangle has a perimeter of 62 cm and a width of 15 cm. What is its area?
questions.explanation: Perimeter = 2(length + width). Therefore, length = (62 ÷ 2) - 15 = 16 cm. Area = length × width = 16 × 15 = 240 cm²

questions.question: The area of a rhombus is 120 square centimeters and one of its diagonals is 20 centimeters. What is the length of the other diagonal?
questions.explanation: Area of rhombus = (1/2) × product of diagonals. Therefore, other diagonal = (2 × area) ÷ given diagonal = (2 × 120) ÷ 20 = 12 cm

questions.question: A circle has an area of 803.84 square centimeters. What is its radius? (Use π = 3.14)
questions.explanation: Area = πr² = 803.84. Therefore, r² = 803.84 ÷ 3.14 = 256. Therefore, r = √256 = 16 cm

questions.question: The perimeter of a rectangle is 54 cm and its area is 180 square centimeters. What are its dimensions?
questions.explanation: Let length = l and width = w. Then 2(l + w) = 54 and l × w = 180. Solving these equations gives l = 15 cm and w = 12 cm

questions.question: A regular octagon has a perimeter of 96 cm. What is the length of each side?
questions.explanation: In a regular octagon, all sides are equal. Side length = perimeter ÷ 8 = 96 ÷ 8 = 12 cm

questions.question: The area of a triangle is 63 square centimeters and its base is 14 centimeters. What is its height?
questions.explanation: Area of triangle = (1/2) × base × height. Therefore, height = (2 × area) ÷ base = (2 × 63) ÷ 14 = 9 cm

questions.question: A square and a rectangle have the same area. The rectangle has length 28 cm and width 12 cm. What is the perimeter of the square?
questions.explanation: Area of rectangle = 28 × 12 = 336 cm². Side of square = √336 = 18 cm. Perimeter of square = 4 × 18 = 72 cm

questions.question: The circumference of a circle is 94.2 cm. What is its diameter? (Use π = 3.14)
questions.explanation: Circumference = π × diameter. Therefore, diameter = circumference ÷ π = 94.2 ÷ 3.14 = 30 cm

questions.question: A parallelogram has a base of 22 cm and a height of 16 cm. What is its area?
questions.explanation: Area of parallelogram = base × height = 22 × 16 = 352 cm²

questions.question: The area of a circle is 254.34 square centimeters. What is its radius? (Use π = 3.14)
questions.explanation: Area = πr² = 254.34. Therefore, r² = 254.34 ÷ 3.14 = 81. Therefore, r = √81 = 9 cm

questions.question: A rectangle has a length of 26 cm and an area of 234 square centimeters. What is its perimeter?
questions.explanation: Width = area ÷ length = 234 ÷ 26 = 9 cm. Perimeter = 2(length + width) = 2(26 + 9) = 70 cm

questions.question: The perimeter of a square is 84 cm. What is its area?
questions.explanation: Side length = perimeter ÷ 4 = 84 ÷ 4 = 21 cm. Area = side² = 21 × 21 = 440 cm²

questions.question: A triangle has sides of length 13 cm, 84 cm, and 85 cm. What is its area?
questions.explanation: This is a right-angled triangle (13-84-85). Area = (1/2) × base × height = (1/2) × 13 × 84 = 546 cm²

questions.question: The area of a rectangle is 252 square meters and its width is 14 meters. What is its perimeter?
questions.explanation: Length = area ÷ width = 252 ÷ 14 = 18 meters. Perimeter = 2(length + width) = 2(18 + 14) = 70 meters

questions.question: A circle has a radius of 16 cm. What is its circumference? (Use π = 3.14)
questions.explanation: Circumference = 2πr = 2 × 3.14 × 16 = 100.2 cm

questions.question: The area of a trapezium is 240 square centimeters. Its parallel sides are 30 centimeters and 42 centimeters. What is its height?
questions.explanation: Area of trapezium = (1/2)(sum of parallel sides) × height. Therefore, height = (2 × area) ÷ (sum of parallel sides) = (2 × 240) ÷ (30 + 42) = 480 ÷ 80 = 6 cm

questions.question: A square has an area of 441 square centimeters. What is its perimeter?
questions.explanation: Side length = √441 = 21 cm. Perimeter = 4 × side = 4 × 21 = 84 cm

questions.question: The circumference of a circle is 113.04 cm. What is its radius? (Use π = 3.14)
questions.explanation: Circumference = 2πr = 113.04. Therefore, r = 113.04 ÷ (2 × 3.14) = 18 cm
